Adam...freedom of speech MUST by definition include the most vile hate speech. If you limit someone else's speech in potentia you make a rod for your own back. I would however say calling for murder is probably the fine line even I would draw. But you must draw that line very solidly and not extend it. I find Geert Wilders despicable but have yet to see anything that I wouldn't defend his right to say...because that also defends my right to tear his view down. The ONLY way good ideas can win, and they must win, is if we solidly defend free speech for all. Because if we don't people get lazy, they hide behind the law, they forget their facts and then the only ones who know the facts are those speaking the most despicable filth...and that gives them power and prevents us defeating their views.

Marilyn, I'm an artist and writer myself. And I can sometimes be temperamental. I think it's because we're very in tune with our emotions, so if they get out of whack we can go a bit off the deep end sometimes. I haven't yet watched Lost Girl, Elise, though my friend likes it and recommended it to me too. I also like how they portray the gay teen in Teen Wolf - he's simply gay, but they don't make a big deal out of it. He goes to school, plays lacrosse, has a life outside of his gayness. No one's life is just about their sexuality.

My kids were in a private catholic school with no AC and were absolutely miserable. You can't learn while you're melting and sweating. They barely cracked the windows and had no fans!! I mean COME ON! With open windows and large capacity fans it would at least be humane! Otherwise it's like an oven! Now they're going to go to the extreme and just close schools rather than fix the problem?! So frustrating!! Get wall units if need be!!
